Course will meet once per week on Tuesdays.
Marx and Marxisms: On Racial Capitalism 
This course will serve as an introduction to key concepts in Marx's thought and their transformation by reflections on and resistance to racial capitalism. Readings will provide occasion to discuss the structure of concepts such as alienation, exploitation, originary accumulation, class struggle, ideology, emancipation, racial capitalism, colonialism, development, mass incarceration, police violence, Black liberation, and Black feminism. 
Texts by Karl Marx, Cedric Robinson, Walter Rodney, W.E.B. Du Bois, Angela Davis, Michelle Alexander, Keeanga-Yamahtta Taylor
course_description: Survey of the basic tenets of Marxist thought from Marx to the present. Issues include the nature of value under capitalism, alienation and exploitation, the philosophy of history, class division and struggle, ideology, and revolution. Texts from figures such as Marx, Lenin, Luxemburg, and Mao.
